item.title: How to get a clear view of hierarchical data? Answer: Sunburst Charts
item.dc:creator: Edith Darin
item.description: Sunburst charts are a great tool to visualise hierarchichal data structure and unravel missing combinations. Useful as an exploratory analysis for Bayesian hierarchical models.

item.title: woprVision: a shiny app to visualise Bayesian predictions
item.dc:creator: Edith Darin
item.description: woprVision is a multilingual interacive application to visualise and retrieve Bayesian population estimates

item.title: How fine can a top-down population model be? [draft]
item.dc:creator: Edith Darin
item.description: We will study the use of very high-resolution covariates in top-down population model and its impact on population gridded estimates. We will examine building-footprint derived covariates in Sierra Leone population model. Disclaimer: This post is still being drafted.

item.title: Small area population estimates using random forest top-down disaggregation: An R tutorial
item.dc:creator: Douglas R Leasure
Edith Darin
Andrew J tatem
item.description: An R tutorial on how to develop a top-down population model to disaggregate administrative estimates to a finer spatial resolution.

item.title: Hybrid census in Burkina Faso: Bottom-up population modelling
item.dc:creator: Edith Darin
item.description: I developped a Bayesian bottom-up population modelling to adress the challenge of the incomplete 2020 census in Burkina Faso. The model was combining GPS household location with remote sensing product in a Bayesian hierarchcical framework. The output is a hybrid gridded population that was endorsed by Burkina Faso Statistics Office.

item.title: CoopCycle: we socialize platform
item.dc:creator: Edith Darin
item.description: Since 2017 I am a vice-president of the CoopCycle association that fights for fair working rights in the bike delivery sector.
